name: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A story set in the distant future that follows the political and interstellar struggles of noble houses.

name: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The story of a mathematician who predicts the fall of the Galactic Empire and sets out to preserve humanity's knowledge.

name: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A young boy is trained in a battle school to prepare for an alien invasion.

name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction series that follows the adventures of an ordinary human and his alien friend.

name: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A cyberpunk novel that explores the concept of artificial intelligence and its impact on society.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where independent thought is forbidden.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A novel that explores a future where genetic engineering and psychological manipulation are commonplace.

name: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
description: A classic tale of a Martian invasion of Earth and humanity's struggle for survival.

name: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A cyberpunk novel that explores a future where virtual reality and the internet dominate society.

name: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: A story of an astronaut who is stranded on Mars and must find a way to survive and return to Earth.

name: I, Robot
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A collection of short stories that explore the relationship between humans and intelligent robots.

name: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian novel set in a future where teenagers are forced to participate in a televised fight to the death.

name: The Time Machine
author: H.G. Wells
description: A story of a man who invents a machine that can travel through time and his adventures in the future.

name: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel set in a future where books are banned and burned by the government.

name: The Matrix
author: Sophia Stewart
description: A science fiction film that explores the concept of a simulated reality and a rebellion against machines.

name: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton
description: A novel that tells the story of a theme park filled with genetically engineered dinosaurs.

name: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: A story set in a dystopian future where people escape the real world by entering a virtual reality game.

name: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A novel set in a totalitarian society where women are oppressed and used for reproductive purposes.

name: Starship Troopers
author: Robert A. Heinlein
description: A military science fiction novel that explores the concept of a future war against insectoid aliens.

name: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: A novel set in a utopian society where all memories of the past have been erased.
